data.title: Delicious breakfast the biscuits were light, flaky and amazing.
data.text: We have eaten inside and on the patio.  The waitstaff is very friendly and accommodating, the atmosphere is welcoming.

data.title: Mouthwatering food in an unexpected place!
data.text: We were referred to Lucile's by the vet doctor at the hospital we took our pet to. It was hard to find at first and seemed like a small little place, but once inside the atmosphere was very Cajun and cozy. Everything we ordered was amazing and full of flavor and presented in such an amazing way. I've never taken pictures of food before but this place made me do just that! Amazing food for all tastes!

data.title: Absolutely fabulous Breakfast ,BUT long crowded wait
data.text: There is no doubt Lucile's has one of the best breakfasts in fort Collins, the dishes are to die for and their coffees and teas are wonderful. they have a variety of dishes from cajun to basic. BUT be prepared for long long waits, and realize this is a small place so there isn't any waiting area except outside and it gets really packed on weekends. The staff is incredible, I don't know how they do it all in this small space.

data.title: Best breakfast in town
data.text:
We have loved Lucile's for years and again this morning had a wonderful breakfast there. 
The food is always good and the locals know it, so be prepared for a wait outside most visits (we went at 10 am on a Friday and waited about 10 minutes for a table for 2). Don't worry, it's worth it! 
We adore our server, Sarah, who is one of the many delightful people who are completely on point at Lucile's. Sarah is always friendly, cheerful, and attentive even when it's obvious that the restaurant has been slammed all morning. I don't know how she does it, but after many visits I've never seen her be anything less than stellar. 
We love the eggs sardou and the rice pudding porridge. The biscuits are to die for with their homemade strawberry rhubarb jam, the beignets are authentic as is the chicory coffee, and the house orange spice tea is lovely. 
Love, love, love this place. A must visit in Fort Collins.

data.title: Luciles
data.text: Great food and really cute restaurant. Best Po Boy i have ever had. Waitress was friendly and super helpful. Definite do over!

data.title: Cajun Breakfast!!
data.text: This was so good. Service was friendly and on point. Food was great, especially the Cajun Breakfast and the French Toast. Really cute house restaurant. Can't recommend it enough.

data.title: New Orleans style restaurant
data.text: Can you get southern hospitality in N Colorado, yes! This is a top notch, professionally run restaurant. Smiles and good cheer abound. The decor and ambiance is cozy, home style. Be hungry my friends! Thirsty too. I had a screw driver made with fresh squeezed OJ and premium vodka, mmm, not on the menu but the server was happy to prepare it. Nice heavy pour. The kitchen is all pro, lots of items are made from scratch, like the biscuits. We consider Lucille's a special occasion place and enjoy taking out of town guests here.

data.title: The best breakfasts I've ever had
data.text: I love the food at Lucile's. Their breakfasts are unique and the biscuits and gravy are the best I've ever had, including what I make

data.title: Well worth the wait.
data.text: Ft Collins has many great restaurants but the great find was Lucile's.It is just a little yellow house adjacent to the Lincoln Center on Meldrum street. You can tell it is great by the crowd of people that are gathered out side waiting to get in.Walk in and give them your phone number and wait for the call. In the mean time you can enjoy some great chicory coffee or fresh hand squeezed Orange juice (with or without the vodka) up to you,or the best Bloody Mary's around.Once seated I prefer the Cajun Omelette My wife the Pan Pardu with one of the best Biscuits spread with their own rhubarb jam  or Orange marmalade you will ever have. Hanks eggs are a must if you can fit it in but so many things on the menu are to good to talk about, you have to experience it  for your self.Trust me. Oh did I mention the Beignets?

data.title: Laissez le Bon Temps Rouler!
data.text: Let the Good Times Roll!  And Lucile's doesn't disappoint!  Beignets, Chicory coffee, shrimp and grits, collard greens, biscuits as big as your hand.  Missing New Orleans and Creole food? This is your place. Just want an amazing breakfast and coffee? This is your place, too!  The "regular" coffee is, honestly, the best in town. The portions are big. The servers are always friendly and gracious, despite their frenetic pace. As other reviewers have said, "Go early and be prepared to wait..." I've never been to Lucile's or passed by when there wasn't a line of folks waiting for a table. And, to answer your question: Yes! It's totally worth the wait.

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: Excellent place for breakfast.  It's rather small and cramped, but the food and service are great!  Definitely worth checking it out!

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Cajun style breakfast. The beignets were amazing. Fun atmosphere and great wait staff. Big portions.

data.title: Little bit of Louisiana in CO
data.text: Best creol food in town. Beignets like cafe du monde. Chicory coffee is amazing. Little packed so get there early and be prepared to wait. It will be worth it though.

data.title: Just Go!
data.text: Delicious brunch with children and sisters...everyone tried different things and some had dessert.  Wait was long for a table for a big party, but WORTH IT!  Benedicts were delicious.  Beignets were good for not being in Louisiana at Cafe DuMonde.  Desserts were decadent.  Service was great.  A must-do whenever you are in Fort Collins. Great biscuits and many Cajun choices (although that was not my choice).  Loved it!

data.title: A breakfast worth the wait in line
data.text: Oh, boy. What scrumptious food. A selection of dishes that make it hard to choose. Took my sister there when she visited from out of town. We could have been completely happy with a superb biscuit with their jams, butter and some delicious coffee, refilled every time a smiling waitress passes the table, which is often. But we had to try the grits--amazing. Top that off with some eggs (so many ways) and you have a breakfast that you'll be thinking about til the next time you wander in.

data.title: Wow!!
data.text: THIS PLACE!!! I can't wait to go there again!  The food is amazing, the atmosphere is beautiful, the homemade jams and jellies for the BEST BISCUITS EVER are so lovely and tasty and I couldnt stop eating them!!  Haha if you like Louisiana style food at all you will LOVE Lucille's!  They have cloth napkins and there was 3-ply paper in the bathroom!!!  WHO KNEW THERE WAS SUCH A TREAT??!!!  Hahaha. Breakfast and lunch is the greatest here!!

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Shut your mouth. Lucile's is the best. For an authentic Cajun breakfast fare eat here. It's worth being miserably full afterwards! Try the homemade biscuits! You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Great place for breakfast.
data.text: Breakfast with a Cajun flair.  Portions are huge! We should have shared half an order.  Waiter was very helpful. Biscuits are homemade and delicious! Fresh Beignets are served. I would definitely eat there again.

data.title: Breakfast Abundantly
data.text: Nothing more to say. A bit of New Orleans flare. We had three different breakfast dishes at our table plus bingnets. All were wonderful. Consider splitting an entree. Lots of food. Plan to wait for a table.

data.title: Large tasty portions
data.text: Come hungry for breakfast and ask about half portions, because even those can be pretty big. The atmosphere is hopping and the staff is really nice. The biscuits are to die for, and the beignets are hot and fresh.
